avalancheActivity.highlights: Little snow is left in the mountains and the remaining snow has gotten stiff and more stable after the frost started.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow melted away widely in the warming episode last week. Some snow remains however in certain places in the mountains but that snow has gotten stiff and stable after freezing started again. The snowpack is therefore likely homogenous and strong. Minor snowfall last night had little impact on the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.comment: Northern storm has been ongoing in the North and the Eastfjords today and it will continue throughout Wednesday. Wind slabs will form widely in southern facing hills but also in gullies and depressions. The new snow is expected to be unstable the first days after the snowfall but the snowfall will continue throughout Thursday in milder winds.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed widely around the North and East of the country in northern winds. Older melt-freeze snow is widely considered stable in other regions.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætis veður út mánudag en NA strekkingur út þriðjudag. Mögulegir litlir éljabakkar á þriðjudag í NA átt. Lægir með miðvikudeginum. Frost víða -10 til fjalla en gæti náð -15 til fjalla við lok miðvikudags.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Thin covering of snow is on top of older snow, which is considered stable. Small windslabs could form on SW aspects in the next few days.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Little snow is in the area. Thin covering of snow is now on top of older snow, which is considered homogenous and stable. The new snow might form windslabs on SW aspects in the next few days.

travelAdvisory.comment: Northern storm has been ongoing in the North and the Eastfjords today and it will continue throughout Wednesday. Wind slabs will form widely in southern facing hills but also in gullies and depressions. The new snow is expected to be unstable the first days after the snowfall but the snowfall will continue throughout Thursday in milder winds.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed widely around the North and East of the country in northern winds. Older melt-freeze snow is widely considered stable in other regions.

weatherForecast.highlights: N/NA 10-18 m/s á þriðjudag og úrkomulítð. Dregur úr vindi á miðvikudag og snjókoma um kvöldið. Á fimmtudag er útlit fyrir NA/A-læga átt með snjókomu á köflum. Áfram kalt í veðri.

avalancheActivity.comment: 3 wet avalanches fell in Héðinsfjörður likely in the warm episode of last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has been through melt-freeze cycles but new snow is expected in N-winds the next days. Snow could drift and form wind-slabs in S facing hills and the new snow will likely be unstable the first days after the storm.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The older snow has been through freeze-thaw cycles and gotten stable but new snow is expected in strong N-winds on Wednesday. The thawing from last week propably had less effect on the snowpack high in the mountains, resulting in a steep temperature gradient when the frost returned and possible faceting of weak layers. Snowfall will be intense on Tuesday and the new snow is expected to be unstable the first days after the storm. Surface hoar could have formed in the snowpack high in the mountains and the new snow will bury it, resulting in a weak layer. Wind slabs will also likely form in S facing hills.

travelAdvisory.comment: Northern storm has been ongoing in the North and the Eastfjords today and it will continue throughout Wednesday. Wind slabs will form widely in southern facing hills but also in gullies and depressions. The new snow is expected to be unstable the first days after the snowfall but the snowfall will continue throughout Thursday in milder winds.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed widely around the North and East of the country in northern winds. Older melt-freeze snow is widely considered stable in other regions.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvöss N-átt allt að 30 m/sek með talsverðri snjókomu á þriðjudag. Snjókoma heldur áfram yfir miðvikudag en dregur úr ákefð. Hitastig í kringum -16 upp til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Slab avalanches occurred in Lambeyrardalur in Eskifjörður and Bagall in Norðfjörður on Jan 8th. The same day, multiple small loose avalanches occurred in the area.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snowfall is expected on Tuesday and Wednesday during strong northerly winds so windslabs are expected to form on south- and easterly aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snowfall on Tuesday and Wednesday during N/NW winds, the new snow could bond poorly with the older snow and quickly develop windslabs that could be unstable. The older snow was widely considered stable after thaw and frost. Persistent weak layers could still be present at high elevations and cause large avalanches. Weak layers could develop in the snowpack during the cold weather.

travelAdvisory.comment: Northern storm has been ongoing in the North and the Eastfjords today and it will continue throughout Wednesday. Wind slabs will form widely in southern facing hills but also in gullies and depressions. The new snow is expected to be unstable the first days after the snowfall but the snowfall will continue throughout Thursday in milder winds.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed widely around the North and East of the country in northern winds. Older melt-freeze snow is widely considered stable in other regions.

weatherForecast.highlights: N/NV 13-20 m/s og snjókoma með köflum. NA-læg átt um tíma. Mikill skafrenningur. Áfram kalt í veðri.
